text: Hey Kevin, is this still happening?

Hi everyone, i am trying to remove the "?hslang=de" Parameter from my Url´s. Is this because the  primary language was set to German under "Domains and Urls" - i have also checked that not Language on the Page Level is selected.

Hey! Has anyone had a client that uses Imperva as a DNS proxy? We have a client that was setup on HubSpot, all was well, then they signed up to use Imperva for added security on their domain and site. The site DOES still load as expected and seems fine. However, within HubSpot, it now says the domain is not connected and that the required DNS setup is not done. We’ve been back and forth with different people involved, but getting nowhere. Any suggestions on what we may need to do here to resolve this?

There is probably no way to solve this. HubSpot uses Cloudflare for Website Protection. Adding another layer is not supported at first and kinda redundant at second. You will most likely have even worse experience when adding Imperva. The Domains have to be configured directly with HubSpots Cloudflare, whats not compatible with third party Hosting providers in the middle. You will most likely have to drop Imperva.

Imperva is adding nothing in this context. It’s very likely it could be breaking a bunch of things. Additionally - if misconfigured, your site could get blocked/rate limited by Cloudflare - as all requests will be coming from a limited pool of Impervas IP’s rather than the clients/website users IPs.
The problem i am facing is that this link is redirecting to the one without the parameter and the SEO Agency is worried that both links are indexed and create confusion for the Ranking Algorithm
Thanks for the input guys. Much appreciated!
<@U012DUQMS03> Did you figure this one out?
This is likely the easiest way to get a 1 to 1 switch to happen. You can pair the new staged pages with the old pages and then with the flip of a switch swap them all out.

Can you explain a little bit more about what youre trying to achieve? Youre just looking for someone to be able to click on more than one filter and have it show matches containing those 2 filters correct?

If you want it to be interactive and on the same page you will likely need to use some JS.
Thanks to <@U2H3TT8F2>! This can be set as an option under “Domains & Urls” - Language Settings - Enable Language specific redirects”

Hi all, I was about to launch this site for our client, but I just realized that they have 2 portals. The one I am launching is <https://xyz.example.com/> and their other portal which is already live is <https://www.example.com/>. Is it possible to have both of those sites, which shares the same root domain name, on different HS portals?  Or if I do this, will the DNS for the existing site get cobbled and screw up the www site?

Yes it’s possible. A subdomain is seen as a sole entity. And you can have it set up however you like.
You are just setting the DNS-record to point to wherever you want, and whatever system may be on the end of that.
It can be 1, 2 or 1.000 HS portals, or any other kind of system at the other end.
